text: II. The Story of the Ancestors of Israel - Terah. These are the descendants of Terah. Terah begot Abram, Nahor, and Haran, and Haran begot Lot.

The king’s letter to the people was as follows: “King Antiochus sends greetings to the Jewish senate and to the rest of the Jews.
Those who seek the good seek favor, but those who pursue evil will have evil come upon them.
All things have been handed over to me by my Father. No one knows the Son except the Father, and no one knows the Father except the Son and anyone to whom the Son wishes to reveal him.
They returned once more to Jerusalem. As he was walking in the temple area, the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders approached him
While he was speaking, a woman from the crowd called out and said to him, “Blessed is the womb that carried you and the breasts at which you nursed.”
She said to him, “Yes, Lord. I have come to believe that you are the Messiah, the Son of God, the one who is coming into the world.”
At that time some prophets came down from Jerusalem to Antioch,
and this is my covenant with them when I take away their sins.”

By faith he left Egypt, not fearing the king’s fury, for he persevered as if seeing the one who is invisible.
